00047 #define _FC_TABLE_P_H_
00048

00050 extern "C" {
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00055  * \brief Indent string for _fc_printXTable() routines.
00056  */
00057 #define INDENT_STR "    "
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup PrivateTable
00061  * \brief A string of hyphens to use as a table divider for 
00062           _fc_printXTable() routines 
00063 */
00064 #define TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING "----------------------------------------------\n"
00065 
00066 /** 
00067  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00068  * \brief  Get a handle from a table slot
00069  *
00070  * \description
00071  * 
00072  *    Copies values from the table slot into the handle 
00073  *    Warning! No type checking
00074  */
00075 #define _FC_GET_HANDLE(handle /* output - the handle to be made */, \
00076                        xSlot_pointer /* input - a pointer to a table slot */) \
00077          ( (handle).slotID = (xSlot_pointer)->header.slotID, \
00078            (handle).uID = (xSlot_pointer)->header.uID )
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * \ingroup  PrivateTable
00082  * \brief Slot Header
00083  *
00084  * \description
00085  * 
00086  *   This header is used as the first entry for all types of slots in
00087  *   the data tables. It contains basic identifying information including
00088  *   the slot ID (index into a particular data table), the sequence
00089  *   ID (an identifier which is unique over all types of data slots),
00090  *   a name string and some state flags. The state flags are described below.
00091  *   Note that the writable flag only applies to the disk representation of
00092  *   the entity, all in-core entities can be modified. 
00093  */
00094 typedef struct {
00095   int slotID;    /**< This slot's index into its owning table. */
00096   int uID;       /**< Unique identifier for this entity. Since slots can be 
00097                      reused, this is needed to make sure that handle is 
00098                      still referring to the same entity. uIDs are unique
00099                      over all tables and all time (unless uID overflows). */
00100   char *name;    /**< Name for entity described by this slot. */
00101   //int writable;  /**< Flag indicating whether entity is writable (e.g. can be 
00102   //                 modified on disk). 
00103   //                 1 = writable, 0 = read-only (0 is the default). */
00104   int committed; /**< Flag indicating whether current data on an entity is
00105                      the same as on disk. 1 = committed, 0 = data in file and 
00106                      data in memory differ (0 is the default). */
00107 } _FC_SlotHeader;
00108 
00109 // slot header routines
00110 FC_ReturnCode _fc_setSlotHeaderName(_FC_SlotHeader *header, char *name);
00111 void _fc_initSlotHeader(_FC_SlotHeader *header);
00112 void _fc_clearSlotHeader(_FC_SlotHeader *header);
00113 void _fc_printSlotHeader(_FC_SlotHeader header);
00114 
00115 // table routines
00116 _FC_SlotHeader* _fc_getNewSlot(int* tableSize, _FC_SlotHeader*** table,
00117                       FC_SortedIntArray* openSlots, int slotSize);
00118 _FC_SlotHeader* _fc_getSlot(int slotID, int tableSize, _FC_SlotHeader** table);
00119 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteSlot(int slotID, int tableSize, _FC_SlotHeader** table,
00120                     FC_SortedIntArray* openSlots); 
00121 int _fc_isHandleValid(int slotID, int uID, int tableSize, 
00122                 _FC_SlotHeader** table);
00123 
00124 
00125 #ifdef __cplusplus
00126 }
00127 #endif

00129 #endif // _FC_TABLE_P_H_
